title: How to Use Emojis in Instagram Posts, Stories, & More

steps.title: Use the default emoji options to quickly add a reaction in a comment.
steps.content: Use the default emoji options to quickly add a reaction in a comment. If you want to use emojis in a comment, the Instagram app makes it easy. Tap the speech balloon icon under a post you want to comment on to open the comments section. Then, select one of the default emoji options above the text field at the bottom of the screen to add it to your comment. This method offers only a few of the most popular emojis: the red heart, raised hands, fire, clapping hands, crying face, face with heart eyes, surprised face, and laughing face. If you want more options, you’ll need to use your phone’s emoji keyboard.

steps.title: Tap the emoji symbol on your phone’s keyboard for more options.
steps.content: Tap the emoji symbol on your phone’s keyboard for more options. If you want to add something a little more special to your comment, tap the comment text field to open your phone’s keyboard. Then, tap the emoji symbol, which usually looks like a smiley face. On an iPhone, you’ll find it at the bottom left side of the keyboard. On an Android, it’s at the top. Tap any emoji to add it to your comment.

steps.title: Use your phone’s emoji keyboard to add emojis to post captions.
steps.content: Use your phone’s emoji keyboard to add emojis to post captions. Emojis are a great way to add flair to the caption of any Instagram post. Start creating your post as you normally would, then tap the Add a caption text field to open your phone’s keyboard. Tap the emoji icon to access your library of emojis, and then tap any emoji to add it to your caption.

steps.title: Add emojis to reels and stories with the Stickers feature.
steps.content: Add emojis to reels and stories with the Stickers feature. Did you know that you can jazz up your videos on Instagram by adding emojis and other stickers? Here’s how to do it: Start creating a new reel or story . After you edit the clip you want to use, you’ll get to a screen where you can add extra features, such as text, sounds, visual effects, or stickers. Tap the sticker icon in the toolbar. It looks like a square sticker with a smiley face on it and one corner folded over. Type some keywords into the Search bar at the top of the screen (e.g., “smile” or “heart”). If there are any emojis that match, they’ll show up at the top of the search results! Tap the one you want to add it to your reel or story. Alternatively, you can select the reaction sticker option from the list of sticker types that pops up when you tap the sticker button. It looks like a round speech bubble with an emoji in it. If you choose this option, you’ll be prompted to customize your reaction sticker with the emoji you want before adding it to your video. Use one of the default options at the bottom of the screen, or tap the + button to browse more emojis. Tap and drag the emoji to move it around. When you’ve placed it where you want it, finish posting your reel or story.

steps.title: Tap and hold a message in your DMs to add an emoji reaction.
steps.content: Tap and hold a message in your DMs to add an emoji reaction. Just like on Facebook Messenger, you can use emojis to quickly react to DMs on Instagram . To do it, open a conversation, then tap and hold the message you want to react to. Select from one of the default emojis in the menu that pops up, or tap the + icon to browse additional emojis. Tap and hold the emoji you select to get an animated “super react.” You can also use your device’s emoji keyboard to add emojis to DMs. Just tap the text field where you’d type your message, tap the emoji symbol on your keyboard, and select the emoji you want.

steps.title: Click the emoji icon in the comment field to add emojis to comments.
steps.content: Click the emoji icon in the comment field to add emojis to comments. On the Instagram website, navigate to a post you want to comment on. Click the speech bubble icon below the post to open the comment section. Next to the text field that says Add a comment , click the smiley face icon to open a menu of emojis to choose from. You’ll see a selection of the most popular emojis at the top, but you can scroll down to view other options. Once you find an emoji you want to use, click on it to add it to your comment. You can also use your computer’s built-in emoji keyboard to add emojis. On a Windows PC, click the text field, then press ⊞ Win + . to open the emoji keyboard. steps.title: Click the emoji icon to add emojis to post captions.
steps.content: Click the emoji icon to add emojis to post captions. It’s very simple to add emojis to posts in the desktop version of Instagram. Start creating your post as you normally would, then click the smiley face icon in the lower-left corner of the caption area. Scroll through the menu of emojis to find the one you want, then click it to add it to your post. You can also use your computer’s emoji keyboard, if you prefer. While you can post videos on the desktop version of Instagram, you can’t add emoji stickers directly to the video like you can in the mobile app. You can only use emojis in the caption.

steps.title: Add emojis to DMs with the emoji button.
steps.content: Add emojis to DMs with the emoji button. The desktop version of Instagram has an emoji button built into the text field in the DM section. Click the icon that looks like a smiley face to the left of the text field where you’d type your message, then scroll to browse the emoji menu. Click the one you want to add it to your message. Alternatively, use your computer’s emoji keyboard.

steps.title: Hover over a message and click the React button to add an emoji reaction.
steps.content: Hover over a message and click the React button to add an emoji reaction. You can also quickly react to a DM with an emoji. To do this, hover your cursor over the message you want to react to. A popup menu will appear. Hover over the smiley face icon, and you’ll see text that says React . Click the icon to browse a menu of emojis. Click the one you want to add it as a reaction.
